page.title: 03All Saints Church
page.content: All SAints Church is of the Church of England denomination.It belongs to the Wantage Downs group of churches which is shared by a rector and two vicars. A service is held every Sunday. The church dates from the 12th century and is mainly flint.The tower dates from the 15th century and is of stone which is thought to have come from the ruins of Poughley monastery. Inside the door,on the left is the font.There is no organ but a harmonium is used.Under the tower hang the ropes for the peal of five bells. Two date from about 1420 and are some of the oldest in the county.The fifth bell was added in 1937 by Dorothy Puxley in memory of her parents who were Wroughtons of Woolley Park.The first recorded rector was Edmund Little D.D. Master of Balliol College Oxford resigning in 1606.
